Do you know how they go from 800G to 1.6T? I assume they add channels, from 4 to 8, with each channel having a 200G data rate, but I coul be way off. If I'm roughly right, does each channel need to transmit at a different frequency? I'm guessing that the modulation rate is currently limited to a few picosec and that limits the BW of a channel.

So go ahead and sell a little at the all time high.  Monday could be another all time high.  The PT was just increased to $120 and earnings are coming in a about three weeks.  I expect to see strong 800G growth and an increase in revenue.  Nothing wrong with holding while AI is exploding.

For all the long timers here including Finisar holders don't forget how volatile this stock is.  Nothing wrong with selling a little at the all time high.   Really has now outperformed LITE but has been a long time coming.  Here's to patience!

So basically the stock has to get to $163 for you to lose anything.   Above that you would have been better holding, but it's also over two years away.  That's a great premium.  But if earnings are strong we could see $120 and the premium would be much higher.

I still don' t mess with puts.And when I write calls it's always close in usually a few weeks to a month or two as some stocks have very thinly traded of the off Fridays.Often that's how I try and squeeze out a few more bucks when I want to sell a little.  Covered calls or generous sliding stops and never of rmore than 1/4 of the common that I hold.Luckily all mine are in ROTHs so no tax worries.

Couldn't resist selling a Jan/27 (covered) $140 call for $23.2 today, when the stock was $103. At or above $140 this provides, at worst, a 27%/yr profit. Earlier, when the stock was at $88 I sold a Jan/27 $85 put for $21.5. Just experimenting with options to earn a bit of change.

The positive in my view is that the strategic re-alignment is in full swing.  This is the first step.  More news should be forthcoming I would think - perhaps closer to the quarterly report.

Optimization of profits is the goal for the long term . Also revenues would be decreased for now. Less profitable units would be eliminated . More capital resources could be utilized towards to expansion of  more profitable business in the near future . Today's retreat is to shake out those  weak positions and to squeeze shorts in the near future.
